God was invented to help man fathom the (then) inexplicable 'beauty' and 'order' in the world (which, of course, is subjective). the devil was invented to help man fathom the equally inexplicable 'pain' and 'horror' that exists in the world. these two concepts were promoted and developed into maturity at a time when most of the world's population was gullible and illiterate, and when the mode of education was by story-telling, where the story-teller would undoubtedly add exaggerations and legendary aspects to captivate his audience and ensure that the story itself would be preserved. there were no objective journalism then (as if there is any today :p), and since noone could read, knowledge and news was conveyed by word of mouth.
 
 today, religion relies on these characters (God and Satan) to create a living guide for its members. however, as science develops, we realize that the "inexplicable" (order/chaos) is actually logically explicable, and has nothing to do with order or chaos.
 
 there is no use for a God or Satan. they served their purpose for the period of mystery and void, but are no longer need
